question.text: The haemoglobin of a human foetus

options.text: has a lower affinity for oxygen than that of the adult and the oxygen dissociation curve is towards right.
has affinity for oxygen the same as that of an adult.
has a higher affinity for oxygen than that of the adult and the oxygen dissociation curve is towards right.
has a higher affinity for oxygen than that of an adult and the oxygen dissociation curve is towards left.

solution.text: The haemoglobin of a human foetus has a higher affinity for oxygen than that of an adult. Haemoglobin is a group of globlar proteins occurring widely in animal as oxygen carriers in blood. As a result, the oxygen dissociation curve is towards left.
